channel.title: How to make a simple code generator?
channel.description:
No, not a keygen.
How can I make a simple code generator in Java? I don't need to know how to all of it, only how, if the user enters for example, "asterisk ostrich yellow nosed architecture on Monday after Oboe practice." in a text box, and click the Generate button, make it print out:
"You entered, asterisk ostrich yellow nosed architecture on Monday after Oboe practice."
That's all I need help with. Thank you.

item.title: How to make a simple code generator?
item.dc:creator: @mlp311 mlp311
item.description:
@mlp311 wrote:

The UI is a bit ugly, but I did it for you.

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.EventQueue;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.border.EmptyBorder;
import javax.swing.JTextField;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;

public class Test extends JFrame {
	private static final long serialVersionUID = 6067354106716019216L;
	private JPanel contentPane;
	private JTextField textField;

	/**
	 * Launch the application.
	 */
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
			public void run() {
				try {
					Test frame = new Test();
					frame.setVisible(true);
				} catch (Exception e) {
					e.printStackTrace();
				}
			}
		});
	}

	/**
	 * Create the frame.
	 */
	public Test() {
		setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		setBounds(100, 100, 450, 300);
		contentPane = new JPanel();
		contentPane.setBorder(new EmptyBorder(5, 5, 5, 5));
		contentPane.setLayout(new BorderLayout(0, 0));
		setContentPane(contentPane);

		textField = new JTextField();
		contentPane.add(textField, BorderLayout.NORTH);
		textField.setColumns(10);

		JButton btnNewButton = new JButton("Press This");
		btnNewButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
			public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event) {
				JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(Test.this, "You entered: " + textField.getText());
			}
		});
		contentPane.add(btnNewButton, BorderLayout.CENTER);
	}
}

y2qtQ.png?9859863×489

You create an action listener for when the user clicks the button, then read the contents of the JTextField. You then invoke the showMessageDialog function to show a message dialog that contains the text of the JTextField.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a simple code generator?
